Package com.example.sumon.androidvolley

Class GmailAuthenicationActivity

java.lang.Object
com.example.sumon.androidvolley.GmailAuthenicationActivity
public class GmailAuthenicationActivity extends Object
Public class that lays the foundation to send an email and sets the parameters in order to connect to Gmail's smtp port. Will also send the email once helper classes step in at the end

  • Constructor Details

    • GmailAuthenicationActivity

      public GmailAuthenicationActivity()
      Standard no-parameter constructor, shouldn't be used in this class

    • GmailAuthenicationActivity

      public GmailAuthenicationActivity(String fromEmail, String fromPassword, List toEmailList, String emailSubject, String emailBody)
      Constructor for GmailAuthenicationActivity that should be the only one used. Determines all of the details of the email being sent
      Parameters:
      fromEmail - The email address that the email is coming from, in our case it's always zmans1205@gmail.com
      fromPassword - The password for the email address that the email is coming from, in our case it's a application specific password for my email. "xbsm xojh sbqo zsgp" is that value
      toEmailList - This param determines who the email goes to, in our application we won't send emails to multiple people so it always goes to just one address at a time
      emailSubject - This param determines the emailSubject to be sent
      emailBody - This param determines the emailBody to be sent

  • Method Details

    • createEmailMessage

      public javax.mail.internet.MimeMessage createEmailMessage() throws javax.mail.internet.AddressException, javax.mail.MessagingException, UnsupportedEncodingException
      Public method that creates the MimeMessage which is essentially the Email being constructed with all of the parameters given in the constructor.
      Returns:
      A MimeMessage with all of the email details that is ready to be sent.
      Throws:
      javax.mail.internet.AddressException - This exception can be thrown if any of the Gmail addresses that are given are invalid
      javax.mail.MessagingException - This exception can be thrown if the message attempting to be sent is invalid (null)
      UnsupportedEncodingException - This exception can be thrown if the text/html that we are trying to use is unsupported for any reason

    • sendEmail

      public void sendEmail() throws javax.mail.internet.AddressException, javax.mail.MessagingException
      Public method that sends the email after it's parameters have been set, and it's been created by the previous two methods.
      Throws:
      javax.mail.internet.AddressException - This exception can get thrown if the Transport doesn't connect to Gmail's smtp port correctly
      javax.mail.MessagingException - This exception can get thrown if the Transport isn't able to send the Message correctly
